metadata.titleCn: 祁连山综合观测网：黑河流域地表过程综合观测网（大满超级站叶面积指数-2018）
metadata.description:
This dataset contains the LAI measurements from the Daman superstation in the middle reaches of the Heihe integrated observatory network from June 11 to September 18 in 2018. The site (100.372° E, 38.856°N) was located in the maize surface, near Zhangye city in Gansu Province. The elevation is 1556 m. There are 3 observation samples, each of which is about 30m×30m in size, and the latitude and longitude ranges are (100.373297°E~100.374205°E, 38.857871°N~38.858390°N), (100.373918°E~100.373897°E, 38.854025°). N~38.854941°N), (100.368007°E~100.369044°E, 38.850678°N~38.851580°N). Five sub-canopy nodes and one above-canopy node are arranged in each sample. 
The LAI data is obtained from LAINet measurements following four steps: (1) the raw data is light quantum (level 0); (2) the daily LAI can be obtained using the software LAInet (level 1); (3) the invalid and null values are screened and using the 7 days moving averaged method to obtain the processed LAI (level 2); (4) for the multi LAINet nodes observation, the averaged LAI of the nodes area is the final LAI (level 3).
The released data are the post processed LAI products and stored using *.xls format.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) (for sites information), Qu et al. (2014) for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2018年6月11日至2018年9月18日的黑河水文气象观测网中游大满超级站叶面积指数观测数据。站点(100.372° E, 38.856° N)位于甘肃省张掖市大满灌区内，海拔1556m，下垫面是玉米。观测样方共计3个，每个样方大小约30m×30m，经纬度范围分别为(100.373297°E~100.374205°E, 38.857871°N~38.858390°N)、(100.373918° E~100.373897°E, 38.854025°N~38.854941°N)、(100.368007°E~100.369044°E, 38.850678°N~38.851580°N)。每个样方内布设5个冠层下节点和1个冠层上节点。
本数据集由叶面积指数无线传感网（LAINet）获取，该仪器原始观测数据为仪器自动获取的每个节点逐日逐小时的光照数据（Level0），利用LAINet软件对原始观测数据进行处理，逐节点计算每天LAI（Level1），进一步对无效值识别与填充，并7天滑动平均消除天气变化对LAI计算的影响（Level2），对有多个LAINet节点的观测子区，节点的均值为该子区的最终观测值（Level3）。
本次发布的数据集为处理后的Level3产品，数据以*.xls格式存储。
黑河流域地表过程综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Qu et al. (2014)。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其在发展中国家尤为明显（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持了中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域被先前的研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度、风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时还包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了共11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Verification.QuestionEn: Are long-term observational datasets from oasis–desert systems critical for understanding carbon exchange in these regions?
Verification.QuestionCn: 来自绿洲-沙漠系统的长期观测数据集对于理解这些地区的碳交换至关重要吗？

Verification.QuestionEn: Is the observation of hydrometeorological data in oasis–desert systems performed using automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period?
Verification.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，水文气象数据的观测是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行的吗？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Is the primary method for data collection in oasis-desert ecosystems based on wireless sensor networks, eddy covariance systems, or scintillometers?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，数据收集的主要方法是基于无线传感器网络、涡度协方差系统还是闪烁仪？
Disjunctive.AnswerCn: 涡度相关系统和闪烁仪

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Do challenges in data collection for arid regions primarily involve ecological degradation, data quality control, or technological limitations?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，数据收集的挑战主要涉及生态退化、数据质量控制或技术限制吗？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What are the key methods used for collecting leaf area index data in arid and semi-arid regions?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区收集叶面积指数数据的关键方法有哪些？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: When were the data for leaf area index observations collected in the Heihe River Basin?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域，叶面积指数观测数据的收集时间是什么时候？

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to measure leaf area index in agricultural areas within arid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一种用于测量干旱地区农业区域叶面积指数的数据收集方法的示例？
Example.AnswerEn: The leaf area index in agricultural areas within arid regions, such as the Daman superstation in the Heihe River Basin, is measured using a wireless sensor network called LAINet. This method involves the automatic acquisition of light data at each node on an hourly basis, which is then processed to calculate daily leaf area index values.
Example.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区的农业区域，例如黑河流域的达曼超级站，叶面积指数通过一种名为LAINet的无线传感器网络进行测量。该方法涉及在每个节点上每小时自动获取光数据，然后处理这些数据以计算每日叶面积指数值。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you give an example of the challenges faced in data collection for ecological studies in arid and semi-arid inland river basins?
Example.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱内陆河流流域的生态研究中，数据收集面临的挑战的一个例子是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: Ecological studies in arid and semi-arid inland river basins, such as those along the Silk Road, face challenges like the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These challenges complicate data collection efforts in regions like the Tarim River basin, the Aral Sea basin, and the Lake Urmia basin.
Example.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱的内陆河流流域进行生态研究，例如丝绸之路沿线的地区，面临着河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴等挑战。这些挑战使得在塔里木河流域、阿拉尔海流域和乌尔米耶湖流域等地区的数据收集工作变得复杂。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a dataset that includes long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Example.QuestionCn: 一个包含绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期观测数据集的例子是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A dataset that includes long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems comprises data collected from 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations in the middle and lower reaches of the Heihe River Basin, established since 2012. This dataset is available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center and includes energy, water vapor, carbon fluxes, hydrometeorological data, and vegetation and soil parameters.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个包含绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的长期观测数据集，包含自2012年以来在黑河流域中下游建立的11个地表通量和气象站收集的数据。该数据集可从国家西藏高原数据中心获取，包含能量、水汽、碳通量、气象水文数据以及植被和土壤参数。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the characteristics of datasets related to energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 与绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换相关的数据集的特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: long-term observations, energy fluxes, water vapor fluxes, carbon fluxes, methane fluxes, auxiliary data, hydrometeorology, vegetation parameters, soil parameters, half-hourly turbulent flux data, eddy covariance system, scintillometer, hydrometeorological data, 10-minute average period
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 长期观测、能量通量、水汽通量、碳通量、甲烷通量、辅助数据、水文气象、植被参数、土壤参数、半小时湍流通量数据、涡度相关系统、闪烁仪、水文气象数据、10分钟平均周期。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What specific data collection methods are used to monitor the leaf area index in arid regions?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区监测叶面积指数使用的具体数据收集方法有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: wireless sensor network, LAINet, light data collection, daily and hourly data collection, LAINet software, daily LAI values, 7-day moving average, mean LAI value across multiple nodes
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 无线传感器网络，LAINet，光数据采集，每日和每小时数据采集，LAINet软件，每日LAI值，7天移动平均，多节点的平均LAI值

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with data collection in oasis–desert ecosystems within arid and semiarid regions?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，数据收集面临哪些挑战？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: ecological environment degradation, drying rivers and lakes, natural vegetation degradation, land desertification, frequent dust storms
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 生态环境退化，河流和湖泊干涸，自然植被退化，土地荒漠化，频繁的沙尘暴。

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the total number of ordinary meteorological stations established in the middle and lower reaches of the HRB since 2012 for collecting energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 自2012年以来，在HRB的中下游地区建立的普通气象站总数是多少，用于收集能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据？

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the average time interval used for acquiring turbulent flux data with the eddy covariance system and scintillometer in oasis–desert systems?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在绿洲–沙漠系统中，使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取湍流通量数据的平均时间间隔是多少？

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'eddy covariance system' mean in the context of measuring energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在测量能量、水蒸气和碳通量的背景下，“涡动协方差系统”是什么意思。
Definition.AnswerEn: In the context of measuring energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, an 'eddy covariance system' is a method used to obtain half-hourly turbulent flux data. It involves measuring the fluctuations in wind velocity and scalar quantities like temperature and gas concentrations to estimate the exchange rates of energy, water vapor, and carbon dioxide between the land surface and the atmosphere.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在测量能量、水蒸气和碳通量的背景下，“涡度协方差系统”是一种用于获取半小时湍流通量数据的方法。它涉及测量风速和标量量（如温度和气体浓度）的波动，以估算地表与大气之间的能量、水蒸气和二氧化碳的交换速率。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'oasis–desert system' in the context of ecological and agricultural studies?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在生态和农业研究的背景下，“绿洲–沙漠系统”指的是一种生态系统，其中绿洲作为水源和生物多样性的中心，周围被沙漠环境包围。这种系统展示了水资源的稀缺性与生物生存之间的相互作用，以及人类在干旱地区的农业活动如何依赖于绿洲的水源。
Definition.AnswerEn: In the context of ecological and agricultural studies, an 'oasis–desert system' refers to a unique ecological landscape found in arid and semi-arid areas, where oases serve as the core of ecological environments and are crucial for economic development. They support the majority of the population and play a significant role in maintaining ecological stability and agricultural productivity, especially in the desert areas of western China.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在生态和农业研究的背景下，“绿洲-沙漠系统”指的是一种独特的生态景观，存在于干旱和半干旱地区，其中绿洲作为生态环境的核心，对经济发展至关重要。它们支持大部分人口，并在维持生态稳定和农业生产力方面发挥重要作用，尤其是在中国西部的沙漠地区。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for leaf area index using a wireless sensor network compare to those for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange using an eddy covariance system?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用无线传感器网络收集叶面积指数的数据方法与使用涡度协方差系统收集能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据方法相比，如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The leaf area index data is collected using a wireless sensor network (LAINet) that automatically captures light data at multiple nodes, processed to compute LAI values. In contrast, energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange data are collected using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer, focusing on fluxes with half-hourly data intervals.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 叶面积指数数据是通过无线传感器网络（LAINet）收集的，该网络自动在多个节点捕获光数据，并处理以计算LAI值。相比之下，能量、水蒸气和碳交换数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪收集的，重点关注半小时的数据间隔。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What methodologies can be inferred for processing raw observational data to ensure accuracy and reliability in hydrometeorological and vegetation studies?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 可以推断出哪些方法论用于处理原始观测数据，以确保水文气象和植被研究的准确性和可靠性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Data processing and quality control procedures are essential and are divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing. For example, the datasets use software to process raw observational data to filter out invalid values and apply a sliding average to mitigate the effects of weather variability.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制程序是必不可少的，分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。例如，数据集使用软件处理原始观测数据，以过滤无效值并应用滑动平均，以减轻天气变异的影响。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might challenges such as ecological degradation and land desertification influence the design and deployment of data collection networks in arid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 生态退化和土地沙漠化等挑战可能如何影响干旱地区数据收集网络的设计和部署？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges like ecological degradation and land desertification necessitate the implementation of long-term observational datasets and the establishment of multiple land surface flux and meteorological stations to monitor and understand energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, ensuring ecological stability and supporting sustainable development in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 生态退化和土地沙漠化等挑战需要实施长期观测数据集，并建立多个陆地表面通量和气象站，以监测和理解能量、水蒸气和碳的交换，确保生态稳定并支持绿洲-沙漠生态系统的可持续发展。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What strategies can be implemented to effectively integrate data from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems to support ecological and socioeconomic goals?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 可以实施哪些策略来有效整合人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的数据，以支持生态和社会经济目标？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Integrating long-term datasets from artificial and natural systems involves collecting comprehensive data on energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, alongside hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil parameters. This integration supports the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases by providing quantitative insights into oasis–desert interactions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 整合人工和自然系统的长期数据集涉及收集关于能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量的全面数据，以及水文气象、植被和土壤参数。这种整合通过提供关于绿洲与沙漠相互作用的定量洞察，支持绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it essential to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems for sustainable oasis development?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 保持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡对于可持续的绿洲发展至关重要。
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems is crucial to achieving sustainable development goals because oases are integral to the ecological environment and economic foundation in arid and semi-arid areas. Understanding the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in these ecosystems is vital for carbon peaking, carbon neutrality, ecological security, and the sustainable development of the oasis.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续发展目标至关重要，因为绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区生态环境和经济基础的重要组成部分。了解这些生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换对于实现碳达峰、碳中和、生态安全以及绿洲的可持续发展至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What underlying challenges make data collection in arid and semi-arid inland river basins difficult?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱内陆河流流域，数据收集面临哪些潜在挑战？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Data collection in arid and semi-arid inland river basins is challenging due to ecological degradation issues such as drying rivers and lakes, natural vegetation loss, intensified desertification, and frequent dust storms. These environmental challenges, especially prevalent in regions like the Tarim River basin and others along the Silk Road, complicate the efforts to gather consistent and reliable observational data.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱的内陆河流流域，数据收集面临挑战，主要由于生态退化问题，如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被丧失、沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些环境挑战在塔里木河流域及丝绸之路沿线的地区尤为明显，给收集一致和可靠的观测数据带来了困难。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to employ a wireless sensor network like LAINet for collecting leaf area index data in arid and semi-arid regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，使用像LAINet这样的无线传感器网络收集叶面积指数数据的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Employing a wireless sensor network like LAINet is important because it provides detailed, automated, and continuous observations of leaf area index, which is crucial for understanding surface processes and ecological dynamics in arid and semi-arid regions like the Heihe River Basin. These areas are significant for maintaining ecological stability and supporting economic development, particularly in oasis-desert systems.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 使用像LAINet这样的无线传感器网络非常重要，因为它提供了对叶面积指数的详细、自动化和持续的观测，这对于理解干旱和半干旱地区（如黑河流域）的表面过程和生态动态至关重要。这些地区对于维持生态稳定和支持经济发展，特别是在绿洲-沙漠系统中，具有重要意义。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the goals of maintaining long-term observational datasets involving energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 维护涉及绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳通量的长期观测数据集的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goals of maintaining long-term observational datasets in oasis-desert ecosystems include understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange to achieve sustainable oasis development, support the goals of carbon peaking and neutrality, and protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 维护绿洲-沙漠生态系统长期观测数据集的目标包括了解能量、水蒸气和碳交换的基本特征，以实现可持续的绿洲发展，支持碳达峰和碳中和的目标，并保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it necessary to have a comprehensive observational network for collecting hydrometeorological and vegetation data in inland river basins within arid regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区的内陆河流流域中，建立一个全面的观测网络以收集水文气象和植被数据是必要的，原因如下：
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: A comprehensive observational network is necessary in inland river basins within arid regions to address the ecological degradation challenges such as drying rivers, land desertification, and dust storms. This network provides crucial data that help in managing water resources, understanding ecological dynamics, and supporting sustainable development in these vulnerable areas.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区的内陆河流流域中，建立一个全面的观测网络是必要的，以应对生态退化带来的挑战，如河流干涸、土地沙漠化和沙尘暴。该网络提供了重要的数据，有助于管理水资源、理解生态动态，并支持这些脆弱地区的可持续发展。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are employed to collect and process data for leaf area index measurement in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，测量叶面积指数的数据收集和处理程序包括哪些步骤？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: In the field, a wireless sensor network called LAINet is used to automatically collect light data from each node on a daily hourly basis (Level0). This raw data is processed using specialized software to calculate daily LAI for each node (Level1). Further processing involves identifying and filling invalid values and applying a 7-day moving average to mitigate weather variations' impact on LAI calculations (Level2). For areas with multiple nodes, the average value from all nodes represents the final observation for that area (Level3).
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在该领域，使用一种名为LAINet的无线传感器网络，自动收集每个节点的光数据，频率为每日每小时（Level0）。这些原始数据通过专门的软件处理，以计算每个节点的每日LAI（Level1）。进一步处理包括识别和填充无效值，并应用7天移动平均，以减轻天气变化对LAI计算的影响（Level2）。对于多个节点的区域，所有节点的平均值代表该区域的最终观测结果（Level3）。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are datasets on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems compiled and maintained over time?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 关于绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据集是如何编制和维护的？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Observational datasets consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, along with auxiliary data from artificial and natural oasis-desert systems. The datasets include turbulent flux data obtained every half-hour by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. Hydrometeorological data, such as radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles, are collected from automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period. The data maintenance process involves systematic data collection, processing, and data archiving and sharing.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 观测数据集包括长期的能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的辅助数据。这些数据集包含通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪每半小时获得的湍流通量数据。气象水文数据，如辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面，来自自动气象站，平均采集周期为10分钟。数据维护过程包括系统的数据收集、处理以及数据归档和共享。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the methods for ensuring data quality in hydrometeorological and vegetation datasets collected from oasis-desert regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 确保从绿洲-沙漠地区收集的水文气象和植被数据集数据质量的方法有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Data quality in hydrometeorological and vegetation datasets is ensured through a comprehensive data processing and quality control protocol. The procedure includes collecting data from automatic weather stations and other instruments, processing the data to identify and fill invalid values, and applying statistical methods such as moving averages to smooth out variations caused by environmental factors. Additionally, the datasets are archived and shared, allowing for ongoing verification and validation.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在水文气象和植被数据集中，数据质量通过全面的数据处理和质量控制协议得以确保。该程序包括从自动气象站和其他仪器收集数据，处理数据以识别和填补无效值，并应用统计方法，如移动平均，以平滑因环境因素引起的变化。此外，这些数据集被归档和共享，从而允许持续的验证和确认。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the comprehensive observation of leaf area index in the context of the Heihe River Basin?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在黑河流域全面观测叶面积指数成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of the Leaf Area Index wireless sensor network (LAINet) has enabled the comprehensive observation of leaf area index in the Heihe River Basin by automatically acquiring sunlight data at each node daily and hourly.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 叶面积指数无线传感器网络（LAINet）的使用，使得在黑河流域对叶面积指数的全面观测成为可能，通过在每个节点每天和每小时自动获取阳光数据。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions are necessary to conduct long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中进行长期能量、水汽和碳交换观测所需的条件是什么？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert ecosystems require a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural systems, including half-hourly turbulent flux data acquired by eddy covariance systems and scintillometers, and hydrometeorological data from automatic weather stations.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，长期的能量、水蒸气和碳交换观测需要来自人工和自然系统的一系列观测数据，包括通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的半小时湍流通量数据，以及来自自动气象站的水文气象数据。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How does the integration of multiple observation nodes within a sample plot enhance the accuracy of environmental data collection in arid regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在样本地块内整合多个观测节点如何提高干旱地区环境数据收集的准确性？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The integration of multiple observation nodes within a sample plot enhances the accuracy of environmental data collection by averaging the data across multiple nodes, which helps to account for variability and provide a more representative final observation for the plot.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在样本地块内整合多个观测节点可以通过对多个节点的数据进行平均，从而提高环境数据收集的准确性，这有助于考虑变异性并为该地块提供更具代表性的最终观测结果。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might long-term observational datasets be crucial for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 长期观测数据集对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换可能至关重要的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: A long-term observational dataset provides a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas, which is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases. It supports the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis by achieving the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 长期观测数据集提供了对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义。通过实现碳达峰和碳中和的目标，它支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges might researchers face when collecting data in inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 研究人员在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域收集数据时可能面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms. These challenges can affect data collection efforts.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生。这些挑战可能会影响数据收集工作。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the expected benefits of using multiple nodes in a leaf area index wireless sensor network for data collection?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在叶面积指数无线传感器网络中使用多个节点进行数据收集的预期好处是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Using multiple nodes in a leaf area index wireless sensor network allows for more comprehensive data collection, as it enables the calculation of daily LAI by processing raw data to identify and fill invalid values and apply a 7-day moving average to reduce the impact of weather changes on LAI calculations. The average of multiple nodes' data provides a more reliable observation value for the sub-area.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在叶面积指数无线传感器网络中使用多个节点可以实现更全面的数据收集，因为它能够通过处理原始数据来识别和填补无效值，并应用7天移动平均来减少天气变化对LAI计算的影响。多个节点数据的平均值为子区域提供了更可靠的观测值。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of using a wireless sensor network for collecting leaf area index data in terms of accuracy and data integrity?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估使用无线传感器网络收集叶面积指数数据的有效性，特别是在准确性和数据完整性方面？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The wireless sensor network (LAINet) appears to be an effective method for collecting leaf area index data, as it allows for automated and continuous data acquisition. The data processing includes identifying and filling invalid values and applying a 7-day sliding average to mitigate the influence of weather changes, which enhances data integrity and accuracy.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 无线传感器网络（LAINet）似乎是一种有效的收集叶面积指数数据的方法，因为它允许自动化和连续的数据采集。数据处理包括识别和填补无效值，并应用7天滑动平均，以减轻天气变化的影响，从而提高数据的完整性和准确性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your opinion on the potential for expanding the existing datasets by integrating additional variables or data sources, and how might this improve our understanding of oasis–desert interactions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对通过整合额外变量或数据源来扩展现有数据集的潜力持积极态度，这可能会改善我们对绿洲与沙漠相互作用的理解。
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Integrating additional variables such as methane fluxes, more detailed soil parameters, or remote sensing data could enhance the existing datasets. This expansion could provide a more comprehensive understanding of oasis–desert interactions by capturing a wider range of ecological, hydrological, and atmospheric processes, ultimately supporting better ecological and socioeconomic development strategies.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 整合额外变量，如甲烷通量、更详细的土壤参数或遥感数据，可以增强现有数据集。这种扩展可以更全面地理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用，通过捕捉更广泛的生态、水文和大气过程，最终支持更好的生态和社会经济发展策略。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how the data collection method can effectively capture the leaf area index over time in arid regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据收集方法如何有效地捕捉干旱地区的叶面积指数随时间的变化。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The leaf area index data is collected using a wireless sensor network (LAINet), which automatically captures light data at each node daily and hourly. This data is then processed to calculate daily LAI, identify and fill in invalid values, and apply a 7-day moving average to mitigate weather influences, ultimately providing processed Level3 data.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 叶面积指数数据是通过无线传感器网络（LAINet）收集的，该网络每天和每小时自动捕获每个节点的光数据。然后对这些数据进行处理，以计算每日LAI，识别并填补无效值，并应用7天移动平均以减轻天气影响，最终提供处理后的Level3数据。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the challenges faced in collecting accurate long-term energy and carbon exchange data in oasis-desert ecosystems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中收集准确的长期能源和碳交换数据所面临的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Challenges include ecological degradation such as drying rivers, degraded vegetation, desertification, and dust storms, which are prevalent in inland river basins like the Tarim River basin. These conditions complicate the maintenance and accuracy of long-term observations necessary for understanding energy and carbon exchanges.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 挑战包括生态退化，如河流干涸、植被退化、沙漠化和沙尘暴，这些现象在塔里木河流域等内陆河流流域中普遍存在。这些条件使得维护和准确进行长期观测变得复杂，而这些观测对于理解能量和碳交换是必要的。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how a dataset from oasis-desert systems can include such a wide range of parameters like hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解来自绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集如何包含如此广泛的参数，如水文气象、植被和土壤参数。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The dataset includes parameters from a suite of observational data collected using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer for energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes. Hydrometeorological data is gathered from automatic weather stations, and vegetation and soil parameters are supplemented to provide comprehensive insights from 11 established stations in the region.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 该数据集包括使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪收集的能量、水蒸气和碳通量的观测数据参数。水文气象数据来自自动气象站，植物和土壤参数的补充提供了来自该地区11个已建立站点的综合见解。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore and describe data collection methods employed for capturing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in arid and semiarid oasis–desert systems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨和描述在干旱和半干旱绿洲-沙漠系统中捕获能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据收集方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection methods include using eddy covariance systems and scintillometers to acquire half-hourly turbulent flux data. Hydrometeorological data such as radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, gradients of air temperature and humidity, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles are observed from automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period. Additionally, groundwater table data and supplementary vegetation and soil parameters are collected.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法包括使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取半小时的湍流通量数据。气象水文数据如辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测。此外，还收集地下水位数据以及补充的植被和土壤参数。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify and discuss the challenges faced in the data collection process for monitoring the ecological environment of inland river basins in arid regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别并讨论在干旱地区监测内陆河流流域生态环境的数据收集过程中面临的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges include ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms, particularly in inland river basins like the Tarim River basin and others westward along the Silk Road.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 挑战包括生态环境退化，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴，特别是在塔里木河流域等内陆河流流域以及丝绸之路沿线的其他地区。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please provide an analysis of potential datasets available for studying the interactions between oasis and desert ecosystems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请提供关于可用于研究绿洲与沙漠生态系统之间相互作用的潜在数据集的分析。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets include long-term observational data from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems, consisting of energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. These datasets are freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center and cover the middle and lower reaches of the HRB in the arid regions of western China.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集包括来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的长期观测数据，涵盖能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据，时间范围为2012年至2021年。这些数据集可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取，覆盖中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游。
